result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon Ray Stevens

defendant.name: Stevens, Shannon Ray
defendant.address: 726 Marshall Rd, Apt 2, New Richmond, WI 54017

records.addlTxt: Letter to the court
Letter RE: Competency Report
Order for Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)
Warrant for failure to appear in person, defendant to appear in person for next court date.  Warrants in 19CF122, 19CF131 and 22CF135.

10:42 AM Called 22CF135, 19CF131 and 19CF122 for STC.  Defendant Shannon Ray Stevens appeared by phone, in custody from Dunn Co.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appeared by video for Shannon Ray Stevens.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has notification/letter.  Attny Pollak reviewed letter with def, def on probation hold for St. Croix but being held in Dunn Co thru today.  Court had ordered an in person appearance today.  Court can issue a WA to bring def here, and then do a full hearing and order.  Argument.  Court orders WA as def did not appear in person.  BCSD will retrieve def from Dunn Co.  State makes a statement. Court can then make a findings and order as appropriate.  Def makes a statement.  Attny will talk to def on Mon in jail.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
OCRP Admission Decision
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:53 AM Cases 19CF122, 19CF131, 22CF135 called together.  Defendant Shannon Ray Stevens not in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Shannon Ray Stevens.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases were on for status conference RE: comp report.  Atty Pollak updates- recent contact w/def and evaluator, asks not to issue warrant at this time.  State not objecting to rescheduling, hoping for update to DOC as to Restoration Program.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
of commitment for treatment
No contact with the victims or their residence.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Continue with outpatient treatment and follow recommendations.  Continue with Amery Behavioral Health.

10:04 AM Cases 19CF122 and 22CF135 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shannon Ray Stevens in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Shannon Ray Stevens.  Case 22CF135 is on for competency hearing; 19CF122 on for status conference (tracking as revocation case).  Court recites findings in competency report.  Neither party contests the findings of the report.  State offers copy of the report as an offer of proof.  Court receives/takes judicial notice of the report and its findings.  State argues, references def's Pierce County case 21cm168.  Atty Pollak argues- def on probation hold, DOC requesting a copy of the competency report.  DOC agent appears by Zoom, court addresses her- DOC agent responds, requesting copy of evaluation prior to releasing the hold.  Per Court- Atty Pollak must file a request to release the report to DOC- to file it in the 2019 case.  Court addresses bond- State not objecting to signature bond with no contact.  Court addresses def, amends bond to signature bond.  Court will file an order for outpatient restoration program.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shannon Ray Stevens
Current: 726 Marshall Rd, Apt 2, New Richmond, WI 54017 United States  (Effective: 05-31-2022)
Prior: 9190 County Road D, Webster, WI 54893
Competency hearing on July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Order Pierce County case - release report

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shannon Ray Stevens in court, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Shannon Ray Stevens. Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Court makes record RE: competency evaluation in Pierce County case, Court has approved an order/request for release of comp report to this court.  State asks court to look and see if there is probable cause prior to requesting comp eval.  Court finds, based on complaint, probable cause that a crime did occur and orders a competency evaluation.  Atty Pollak notes revocation is pending and that he will be representing the defendant on that case as well.  19CF122 will track along.
Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 10:45 am.
